colors._comment_backgrounds: Tokens for various UI surface backgrounds

color-background-surface-default.description: Default background for elements like cards, modals, and content areas.

color-background-surface-hover.description: Background color for interactive surfaces on hover.

color-background-surface-active.description: Background color for interactive surfaces when active, pressed, or selected.

color-background-disabled.description: Background color for disabled elements or inputs.

color-text-primary.description: Primary text color for body copy and main content.

color-text-secondary.description: Secondary text color for less prominent information, captions, or subtext.

color-text-disabled.description: Text color for disabled interactive elements or content.

color-text-on-action.description: Text color to be used on top of colored action backgrounds (e.g., primary buttons).

color-border-default.description: Standard border color for UI elements and separators.

color-border-strong.description: A stronger border color, often used for input focus or emphasized separation.

color-border-disabled.description: Border color for disabled elements (can often match disabled background).

color-action-primary-default.description: Default background color for primary action buttons.

color-action-primary-hover.description: Background color for primary action buttons on hover.

color-action-primary-active.description: Background color for primary action buttons when active/pressed.

color-feedback-error-default.description: Default color for error text, icons, and critical borders.

color-feedback-error-background.description: Background color for error messages or input error states.

color-feedback-error-border.description: Border color specifically for error states, often on inputs.

color-icon-default.description: Default color for icons. Contextual icons (e.g., error icons) may use feedback colors.

color-focus-outline.description: Color for focus rings or outlines to ensure accessibility.

spacing._comment_padding: A simple scale for padding and margins. Values are unitless (typically interpreted as px).
